node.name: 80/443 - HTTP
node.rich_text: . In a lot of the recommended CTFs people have put silly things in the comments. I also recommend utilizing burp suite to log the infomation when browsing the webpage.

Use OWASP Zap to scan the website, spider webpages, and identify potential vulnerabilities. They should also provide details links about what the vulnerabilities mean.
**wmap**
If you're really stuck:
node.codebox: nikto -h ip.addr whatweb ip.addr browsh --startup-url http://ip.addr

nmap -p 80,443 --script=http-enum #discover interesting dirs like webdav nmap -p 80,443 --script=http-headers #server header info nmap -p 80,443 --script=banner #pulls http server banner information nmap -p 80,443 --script=http-webdav-scan --script-args http-methods.url-path=/webdav/ #Running webdav scan Nmap script to identify WebDAV installations the script uses the OPTIONS and PROPFIND methods to detect it. nmap -p 80,443 --script=http-methods --script-args http-methods.url-path=/webdav/ #check for allowed methods, should be run on all found pages nmap -p 80,443 --script=http-shellshock --script-args â€œhttp-shellshock.uri=/gettime.cgi" #attempts to exploit shellshock

auxiliary/scanner/http/http_version auxiliary/scanner/http/brute_dirs #dirb alt auxiliary/scanner/http/robots_txt auxiliary/scanner/http/apache_userdir_enum auxiliary/scanner/http/brute_dirs auxiliary/scanner/http/dir_scanner auxiliary/scanner/http/dir_listing auxiliary/scanner/http/http_put auxiliary/scanner/http/files_dir auxiliary/scanner/http/http_login auxiliary/scanner/http/http_header exploit/windows/http/badblue_passthru searchsploit badblue 2.7

wmap_sites -a ip.addr wmap_sites -t http://ip.addr
wmap_run -t #to load all modules wmap_run -e #to scan with all modules in profile wmap_vulns #will list the discovered vulnerabilities
